statement: The claim that 97 percent of scientists believe humans are causing climate change has been debunked by the "head" of the United Nations Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. "That number was pulled out of thin air."
ruling_headline: Santorum: UN climate head debunked widely cited 97% climate change consensus figure
ruling_link_text: Wrong person, wrong study

statement: "The most recent survey of climate scientists said about 57 percent don’t agree with the idea that 95 percent of the change in the climate is caused by CO2."
ruling_headline: Santorum cites flawed climate change figure, and misquotes it
ruling_link_text: 'Two orders of mischaracterization'

statement: If Fox News' presidential debate rules had been in place during the 1992 election, "Bill Clinton wouldn't have been on the stage."
ruling_headline: Fox's debate rules would have kept Bill Clinton off the stage in 1992 election, Rick Santorum says

statement: Says Howard Zinn, "an anti-American Marxist," wrote "the most popular textbook that's taught in our high schools in America."
ruling_headline: Is book by Howard Zinn the 'most popular' high-school history textbook?
ruling_link_text: No hard evidence for that

statement: "Ninety percent of American workers don't own their own business."
ruling_headline: 90% of American workers don't own their own business, Rick Santorum says
ruling_link_text: Different ways to count, but very close

statement: Seventy percent of Americans "don't have a college degree."
ruling_headline: 70% of Americans don't have college degree, Rick Santorum says
ruling_link_text: GOP needs to woo workers, he says

statement: When his grandfather arrived in the United States, "there were no government benefits for immigrants."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says that when his grandfather arrived in the U.S., “there were no government benefits for immigrants"
ruling_link_text: Government benefits were smaller than today, but far from zero
statement_context: a speech at the Republican National Convention in Tampa

statement: Says President Obama has waived "the work requirement for welfare."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum repeats Romney claim that Obama is ending work requirement in welfare
ruling_link_text: That's not what the memo says

statement: "I think it’s seven or eight of the California system of universities don’t even teach an American history course. It’s not even available to be taught."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says seven or eight Calif. universities 'don't even teach' American history
ruling_link_text: All but one — a med school — teach U.S. history

statement: "Polls show Americans are overwhelmingly opposed to Obamacare, especially the individual mandate."
ruling_headline: Santorum says Americans 'overwhelmingly' oppose health law, mandate
ruling_link_text: True of the mandate, and views of the law are becoming more negative
statement_context: an op-ed in "U.S. News & World Report"

statement: Says Mitt Romney said "we are going to have to live with high gas prices, it's a good thing because it will reduce consumption, we don't want to produce any more gasoline."
ruling_headline: Santorum accuses Romney of favoring high gas prices in Massachusetts
ruling_link_text: Not so accurate paraphrase of his words in '06

statement: President Barack Obama’s policies have forced "many parts of the country to experience rolling blackouts."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says 'many parts of the country ... experience rolling blackouts'
ruling_link_text: About as many planned outages as blackouts caused by squirrels
statement_context: a op-ed posted on his website

statement: After President Barack Obama’s health care law takes full effect, "100 percent" of Americans will "depend on some form of federal payment, some form of government benefit to help provide for them."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says after 'Obamacare,' all Americans will be dependent on the federal government
ruling_link_text: At most it would be 60 percent
statement_context: a campaign speech in Steubenville, Ohio

statement: "A little less than 50 percent of the people in this country depend on some form of federal payment, some form of government benefit to help provide for them."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says almost half of Americans receive federal benefits
ruling_link_text: It may even be higher now
statement_context: a campaign speech in Steubenville, Ohio

statement: "If you look up the dictionary definition of happiness at the time of our founders … happiness was not doing what you want to do but doing what you ought to do."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says happiness 'at the time of our founders' was 'doing what you ought to do'
ruling_link_text: Founders' understanding was far more sweeping

statement: Says the federal government "tells health insurance companies how much money they're allowed to keep of what they receive in revenues -- 15 percent."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says government lets health insurers keep only 15 percent of their revenue
ruling_link_text: Not all revenue, not for every plan

statement: "When my grandfather came to this country back in 1925, there were no government benefits."
ruling_headline: Santorum says when his grandfather came to the U.S. in 1925, 'there were no government benefits'
ruling_link_text: Veterans pensions, workers' comp were among programs in place then

statement: Says Rick Santorum "opposes right-to-work"
ruling_headline: Ron Paul says Rick Santorum 'opposes right-to-work'
ruling_link_text: Santorum voted against it in '96, now supports it

statement: Says Mitt Romney said he does not "line up with the NRA."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum ad quotes Mitt Romney distancing himself from NRA
ruling_link_text: Old but accurate

statement: "President Obama once said he wants everybody in America to go to college."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum calls Barack Obama a 'snob' for wanting 'everybody in America to go to college'
ruling_link_text: In most speeches, Obama's clear that's not what he wants

statement: "Amniocentesis, does, in fact, result more often than not in this country in abortion."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says, 'Amniocentesis does, in fact, result more often than not ... in abortion'
ruling_link_text: Most test results come back normal
statement_context: an interview on CBS's "Face the Nation"

statement: After prenatal diagnosis, "90 percent of Down syndrome children in America are aborted."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says "90 percent of Down syndrome children in America are aborted"
ruling_link_text: Studies show 80 to 90 percent, but evidence of regional variation
statement_context: an interview on CBS's "Face the Nation"

statement: "Over 40 percent of children born in America are born out of wedlock."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says over 40 percent of children are born out of wedlock
ruling_link_text: Federal data says yes for 2009, the most recent year available
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Mesa, Ariz.

statement: "When I was born, less than 10 percent of the federal budget was entitlement spending. It's now 60 percent of the budget."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum charts explosion of federal entitlement spending since 1958
ruling_link_text: Wrong figure for 1958, better number for 2011
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Mesa, Ariz.

statement: "When I was born, defense spending was 60 percent of the budget. It's now 17 percent."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says defense spending has fallen since 1958 as percent of federal budget
ruling_link_text: By the measure he uses, Santorum is pretty close
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Mesa, Ariz.

statement: Says in the last 20 years, the French have not "stood by" the United States on foreign policy.
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says you can’t “name one time in the last 20 years that the French stood by us with anything”
ruling_link_text: They have -- time and again

statement: Says Mitt Romney supports cap and trade.
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum ad says Mitt Romney favors cap and trade
ruling_link_text: Evidence says he doesn't
statement_context: a video ad airing in Michigan

statement: "Romney adviser admits Romneycare was blueprint for Obamacare."
ruling_headline: In "Rombo" ad, Rick Santorum says Mitt Romney adviser equated Massachusetts health care law with Obama's
ruling_link_text: Add "former" before "Romney adviser," and it would have gotten a True

statement: "In 2006, I went out and authored a letter with 24 other senators asking for major reform of Freddie and Fannie, warning of a meltdown and a bubble in the housing market."
ruling_headline: Sen. Rick Santorum says he warned 'of a meltdown and a bubble in the housing market'
ruling_link_text: Warning wasn't about a bubble
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Jacksonville, Fla.

statement: "Romneycare … is a top-down, government-run health care system."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum calls Massachusetts health law top-down and government-run
ruling_link_text: Top down, maybe. Not government run.

statement: Florida's economy "became a bad economy ... because of a huge spike in oil prices in the summer of 2008."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says a 2008 spike in oil prices caused Florida's economy to falter
ruling_link_text: You might remember that housing bubble
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Tampa, Fla.

statement: "Speaker Gingrich for 20 years supported a federal individual mandate" for health insurance.
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum calls Newt Gingrich a longtime supporter of insurance mandate
ruling_link_text: Several times
statement_context: a Republican presidential primary debate in Tampa, Fla.

statement: President Obama has "said he is going to cut veterans' benefits."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says President Barack Obama wants to cut veterans’ benefits
ruling_link_text: Cuts are not to VA budget

statement: Says an Obama administration policy prohibits people who work with at-risk youth from promoting marriage as a way to avoid poverty.
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says Obama prohibits encouraging young people to marry
ruling_link_text: Mum on marriage?

statement: As a result of welfare reform, "poverty levels went down to the lowest level ever for ... African-American children."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says welfare reform deserves credit for reductions in African-American child poverty
ruling_link_text: Economy was a big factor too
statement_context: a New Hampshire town hall with voters

statement: Paul Ryan’s Medicare plan provides "pretty much" the same coverage that members of Congress receive.
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says Republicans’ Medicare plan would give seniors same benefits that Congress members receive
ruling_link_text: Substantial differences between plans

statement: Rick Santorum "reformed welfare."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum ad claims he reformed welfare
ruling_link_text: Not all by himself

statement: "Santorum also voted for a teapot museum in North Carolina."
ruling_headline: Rick Perry says Rick Santorum voted for a teapot museum
ruling_link_text: Yes, but not specifically

statement: Says he has "been able to attract independents and Democrats to win" elections in Pennsylvania.
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says he's won votes of Democrats, independents in Pennsylvania
ruling_link_text: Less and less as time went on

statement: The balanced-budget amendment once came within one vote of passing Congress but was defeated because of the no vote from a top Senate Republican, and Rick Santorum says he "stood up and called for him to resign his chairmanship."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says he called for resignation of a high-ranking Republican over no vote on balanced budget amendment
ruling_link_text: Balanced budget vote fell short
statement_context: an op-ed in the "New Hampshire Union Leader"

statement: "The unemployment rate among (the) non-college-educated is well into the double digits in America. It's 4 percent or 5 percent for people who have college degrees."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says unemployment for college grads is 4 to 5 percent but for non-college-educated it's well into double digits
ruling_link_text: Right for college grads; too high for non-college grads
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Michigan

statement: Says Romney wrote in the first edition of his book that his health care plan should be expanded nationwide and then, "You took it out of your book."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum has it wrong on Mitt Romney's book
ruling_link_text: Wrong again on Romney's book

statement: The poverty rate for families in which a husband and a wife work is 5 percent, but in families headed by one person … "it's 30 percent today."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says two-parent families better off financially
ruling_link_text: Marriage equals less poverty

statement: In Europe, "church attendance rates (are) in the single digits" because churches are supported by taxes.
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says church attendance in the single digits in Europe because of government support
ruling_link_text: Not a consistent pattern
statement_context: a house party in Henniker, N.H.

statement: The Medicare drug program "resulted in the program coming in 40 percent under budget. ... And the reason it was, is because the design was right."
ruling_headline: Did Medicare Part D come in 40 percent under budget because of its design?
ruling_link_text: Under budget, but how much and why are disputed

statement: Says President Barack Obama "has put (up) a stop sign … against oil drilling, against any kind of exploration offshore or in Alaska."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says Barack Obama has raised a "stop sign" on oil exploration
ruling_link_text: At most, a "reduce your speed" sign

statement: "The cost-of-living increase in Social Security is tied to wage inflation."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says Social Security cost-of-living adjustments should be based on consumer prices, not wages
ruling_link_text: No, it's tied to consumer prices
statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"

statement: "A third of all the young people in America are not in America today because of abortion, because one in three pregnancies end in abortion."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum says one of every three pregnancies ends in an abortion
ruling_link_text: Flawed math and a questionable leap of logic

statement: "Any child born prematurely, according to the president, in his own words, can be killed."
ruling_headline: Rick Santorum said Obama said "any child" born prematurely "can be killed"
ruling_link_text: Disagreement on abortion taken to an extreme
statement_context: a speech to the Iowa Faith and Freedom Coalition.
